text: George Winston (December 26, 1949 - June 4, 2023) was an American pianist. He was born in Michigan in 1949 but moved to Montana as a child. Most of his music was about the four seasons and landscapes in the United States. He released his first album in 1972. Winston became popular with his 1980 album, Autumn, which was followed by Winter into Spring. His most successful album December was released in 1982. He released a total of 16 albums. His 1994 album Forest earned him a Grammy award. Winston had thyroid cancer, skin cancer, and myelodysplastic syndrome. He died from cancer on June 4, 2023 in Santa Cruz, California at the age of 73. ==Discography== * 1972 Ballads and Blues * 1980 Autumn * 1982 Winter into Spring * 1982 December * 1991 Summer * 1994 Forest * 1996 Linus and Lucy - The Music of Vince Guaraldi * 1999 Plains * 2001 Remembrance - A Memorial Benefit * 2002 Night Divides the Day - The Music of the Doors * 2005 Montana - A Love Story * 2006 Gulf Coast Blues & Impressions: A Hurricane Relief Benefit === Soundtracks === * 1983 The Velveteen Rabbit * 1995 Sadako and the Thousand Paper Cranes * 1989 A Baker's Dozen of Daily Breads and More ==References== ==Other websites== *George Winston official website *Dancing Cat Records - Winston's Record Label Category:American pianists Category:1949 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Musicians from Michigan Category:Musicians from Montana Category:American folk musicians Category:American R&B; musicians Category:American guitarists Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Deaths from thyroid cancer Category:Deaths from myelodysplastic syndrome Category:Deaths from skin cancer
title: George Winston
